lines.text:
[Wayne has goaded Deke into singing at the Buckhorn Tavern... Deke sings to keep peace, he turns to Wayne after he's finished]
Well, you ain't bad, sideburns.
Now tell me what it is you do for a living.
I work with my old man in auto accessories, why?
Well, I usually get paid for singin' as a rule. And I figure you oughta do whatever it is you do for me. So how 'bout steppin' outside and puttin' a new set of seatcovers on my car, huh?
Why sure, sideburns! What color you want?
[turns to the people at his table]
I figure his color's yellow, don't you?
[Deke pulls Wayne out of his seat and starts viciously beating him]

[on the phone]
Get the police, quickly!
[Deke and Wayne continue until Deke wins by a knockout]
It's not my future you care about, it's your's. It's what I can do for you. You don't care about me, or about Tex, or about anybody but yourself.
You've got fifteen minutes to get on that stage and find out if you've even got a future.

[singing]
If-a you don't call me, baby, then I'm never coming home.
What's your number, honey, I'll call ya.

[to the band]
Give him a little boogie-woogie, that'll get him started.
[Band starts playing "Got A Lot Of Livin' To Do"]
Yeah, now go, Deke, GO!

[Wayne is trying to persuade Deke to sing at the Buckhorn tavern after being politely refused]
Now I told my girl I could get you to sing! A man can't go back on his word, can he, fella?

[stands up]
Look, maybe you didn't hear me... "fella", but Mr. Rivers doesn't sing in juke joints. So how about going back over there and drink your malted, huh?

[Wayne shoves Skeeter to the floor, girls gasp]
Hey, are these music people causing some trouble here?

[rushing up]
There's no trouble, sir. You mind if I sing a song with these people here?
Well, uh...

[interrupting]
No, he don't mind!
[menacingly]
Or do you Frank?

[stammering]
No... I don't... mind.
[Deke sings "Mean Woman Blues"]
